title: Applying Probability to Real-World Problems
body: Forty-eight percent of all Californians registered voters prefer life in prison without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder. Among Latino California registered voters, 55% prefer life in prison without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder. $$37.6\%$$ of all Californians are Latino. In this problem, let C $$=$$ Calofornians (registered voters) preferring life in prison without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder and let L $$=$$ Latino Californians. Suppose that one Californian is randomly selected.
